title: The Unusual Techniques That Make This "Forgotten" Retro Cake Tender, Easy, and Delicious
full_text:
The Unusual Techniques That Make This "Forgotten" Retro Cake Tender, Easy, and Delicious
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
45 mins
Total
55 mins
Serves
15
Makes
1 9- by 13-inch cake
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
For the Cake:
Nonstick
cooking spray
57
g
unsalted butter
(
2
ounces
;
4
tablespoons
)
3/4
cup
(
180
ml
)
whole milk
4
large
eggs
(
7
ounces
;
200
g
)
300
g
granulated sugar
(
10 1/2
ounces
;
1 1/2
cups
)
192
g
all-purpose flour
(
6 3/
4
ounces
;
1 1/2
cups
), plus more for dusting
1 1/2
teaspoons
baking powder
1
teaspoon
Diamond Crystal kosher salt
; for table salt, use half as much by volume
For the Topping:
85
g
unsalted butter
(
3
ounces
;
6
tablespoons
)
107
g
dark brown sugar
(
3 1/4
ounces
;
1/2
cup
)
1/4
teaspoon
Diamond Crystal kosher salt
; for table salt, use half as much by volume
1/4
cup
(
60
ml
)
whole milk
198
g
sweetened shredded coconut
(
7
ounces
; about
2 1/3
cups
)
Directions
Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat to 350°F (180°C). Grease a 9- by 13-inch baking pan with unsalted butter, then dust with flour, shaking out excess.
In a medium saucepan, combine butter and whole milk. Bring to a gentle simmer over medium-low heat; set aside and let cool slightly, about 5 minutes.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt; set aside.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, whip eggs and granulated sugar on medium-high speed until yolks are thick, pale yellow, and doubled in volume, about 7 minutes.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Reduce mixer speed to low, and slowly pour in milk and butter mixture. Reserve saucepan for topping; no need to clean. Continue to whisk until combined, about 15 seconds.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
With the mixer on low speed, gradually add flour mixture 1/4 cup at a time until just incorporated, about 2 minutes. Using a flexible spatula, scrape down sides and bottom of the bowl to ensure there are no dry bits. (If any remain, use spatula to gently fold until incorporated.) Pour batter into prepared baking pan and gently tap pan on kitchen counter 2 to 3 times to eliminate any large air bubbles.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Bake until cake has risen by about 1 inch and is light golden, about 25 minutes.
Meanwhile, for the Coconut Topping:
Melt butter over medium heat and cook, whisking and swirling, until milk solids turn golden brown and butter smells nutty, 4 to 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Whisk in brown sugar, salt, and milk and bring to a simmer, stirring constantly until sugar dissolves, 2 to 3 minutes. (Mixture will sputter slightly—this is normal.) Remove from heat and fold in coconut; set aside.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Carefully remove cake from oven and dollop coconut topping over it, using a spoon or offset spatula to spread evenly from side to side. Bake until coconut topping is golden brown, 20 to 25 more minutes.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Special Equipment
9- by 13-inch baking pan, stand mixer, flexible spatula, whisk
Make-Ahead and Storage
Once cooled, the cake can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.
